properties.Name: Mood Swings Network
properties.Description: Charity providing intense support to people with mood disorders and their friends and families.

properties.Name: LGBT Foundation
properties.Description: Provides a wide range of support services to lesbian, gay, bisexual and trans people.

properties.Name: The Proud Trust
properties.Description: Helps young people empower themselves to make a positive change for themselves and their communities; youth groups and peer support.

properties.Name: African Caribbean Care Group
properties.Description: Community Engagement Workers visit older adults, who may be vulnerable due to a long-term health condition, disability or isolation.
properties.Address: Claremont Resource Centre, Rolls Crescent, Hulme

properties.Name: LMCP Care Link
properties.Description: The organisation works with South Asian women with mental health needs.

properties.Name: Manchester Refugee Support Network
properties.Description: Grass-roots organisation directly managed by refugee communities, based in Manchester.

properties.Name: African and Caribbean Mental Health Services
properties.Description: Voluntary charitable organisation that was formed in October 1989 to provide support to African and African Caribbean people with mental health problems aged 16 and over and registered with a Manchester GP.

properties.Name: Relate Greater Manchester South
properties.Description: One to one counselling and relationship service.

properties.Name: Talk Listen Change (TLC)
properties.Description: Counselling and support services for families, individuals and young people.

properties.Name: Black Health Agency
properties.Description: Offers a range of services for people suffering from health inequalities including mental health.

properties.Name: Old Trafford Wellbeing Centre
properties.Description: blueSCI offer sessions from Wellbeing Practitioners and offer activities such as arts, crafts and music open to everyone in the community.

properties.Name: Trafford Domestic Abuse Service
properties.Description: Organisation offering support to both male and female victims of domestic abuse and their families.

properties.Name: Alchemy Arts
properties.Description: Offers a range of activities including music sessions, mindfullness courses and confidence course.

properties.Name: Voice of BME Trafford
properties.Description: Offers advice and signposting to the BME community.

properties.Name: Trafford Centre for Independent Living
properties.Description: Provides services to residents in Trafford who have physical, sensory, learning or mental health impairments.

properties.Name: Trafford Mental Health Advocacy Service
properties.Description: Provides Independent Advocates for qualifiying patients detained under the Mental Health Act.

properties.Name: CDI Community Counselling Service
properties.Description: Qualified counsellors can see people via referral from services or self referral; bilingual counselling for BME groups can be offered.

properties.Name: South Asian Disability Support Network
properties.Description: Network for South Asian families who are affected by disabilities.

properties.Name: Pakistani Resource Centre (Trafford South Asian Mental Health Service)
properties.Description: Working with South Asian individuals (aged 18 years and above) experiencing mental ill-health, their carers, families and communities living in Trafford.
properties.Address: Broome House, 54-56 Seymour Grove, Old Trafford

properties.Name: Trafford eTherapy Service
properties.Description: Online therapy courses delivered by Trafford Self Help Services
properties.Address: Altrincham Library, 19 Stamford New Road, Altrincham

properties.Name: Zion Centre (Peer Support)
properties.Description: Peer Support is built on shared personal experience and empathy, focusing on your strengths not weaknesses with the goal of achieving wellbeing and recovery. Available Monday to Friday.

properties.Name: Chorlton Anxiety Group
properties.Description: This drop-in group offers a sympathetic and non-judgmental space where you can meet others who also struggle with anxiety. Meets on Tuesdays 7-9pm.
properties.Address: Chorlton Methodist Church, Manchester Road, Chorlton

properties.Name: Zion Anxiety Group
properties.Description: Drop-in group offering a sympathetic and non-judgmental space where you can meet others who also struggle with anxiety. Meets on Wednesdays 1-3pm.

properties.Name: Stretford Hearing Voices
properties.Description: Support network for people who hear voices. Meets on Thursdays at 2pm.
properties.Address: St Francis Church, Edge Lane, Stretford

properties.Name: Autistic Society for the Greater Manchester Area (ASGMA)
properties.Description: Offers one to one support and a range of leisure activities for people with autism.

properties.Name: Collaborative Women UK
properties.Description: The organisation leads marginalised women along a safe pathway from crisis to independent living. Drop in on Wednesday afternoons.

properties.Name: Homestart
properties.Description: The organisation supports families with specific needs with children aged birth to 18 years.
properties.Address: Stretford Children's Centre & Early Help Hub, 9 Poplar Road, Stretford

properties.Name: Age UK Trafford (Dementia Service)
properties.Description: The dementia advice and support service has two dementia advisers to support people with dementia and their family carers.

properties.Name: Urmston Depression Group (Trafford Self Help Services)
properties.Description: Drop in group for people suffering from depression. Meets on Tuesdays 1.30-3.30pm.

properties.Name: Leonard Cheshire Disability
properties.Description: Organisation supporting disabled people to live, learn and work as independently as they choose.

properties.Name: The Toy House
properties.Description: Play environment where parents and carers can accompany children. Also offers a supportive listening ear to parents and carers. Meets Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Fridays, 9.30-11.30am and 12.30-2.30pm.

properties.Name: MacMillan Wellbeing Centre
properties.Description: Support centre for people with a cancer diagnosis and their family members or carers who require support. Monthly drop-in sessions take place on the third Wednesday of each month.
properties.Address: Trafford General Hospital, Moorside Road, Urmston

properties.Name: Being There
properties.Description: Small charity providing emotional support and home-based practical help to people with cancer and other life-limiting illnesses.

properties.Name: Alzheimers Society Trafford
properties.Description: Support service for people affected by dementia (carers and people living with a diagnosis).

properties.Name: Salvation Army
properties.Description: The Salvation Army is a worldwide Christian church and registered charity.

properties.Name: Trafford Psychological Therapies
properties.Description: Talking therapies for people aged 16 and over who are registered with a GP in Trafford and are currently suffering from anxiety and depression-related problems.

properties.Name: Victim Support & Witness Service

properties.Address: Sale Town Hall, Sale Waterside, Sale

properties.Name: Talkshop Trafford
properties.Description: Advice and information service for young people aged between 13 and 19 years old (up to 25 depending on circumstances).

properties.Description: Charity which supports unpaid carers looking after people living in Trafford.

properties.Description: blueSCI offer sessions from Wellbeing Practitioners and offer activities such as arts, crafts and music open to everyone in the community.

properties.Description: Art classes and workshops with a focus on working with people with mental health conditions.

properties.Name: The Counselling and Family Centre
properties.Description: Offers one to one counselling services and Cognitive Behavioural Therapy, and group sessions.

properties.Name: Dance System CIC

properties.Address: Altrincham Football Club, Community Sports Hall, Moss Lane, Altrincham

properties.Name: United Response

properties.Name: Manchester Rape Crisis
properties.Description: We are women who provide confidential support services for women and girls who have experienced sexual violence at any time in their lives. Apart from our helpline all services are for women over the age of 18. The helpline is open to all ages.

properties.Name: Samaritans
properties.Description: Offers a safe place for people to talk about anything worrying them.

properties.Name: Target Cafe
properties.Description: The cafe meets every other Saturday and is open to people of all ages who require the support to stay free from drugs and alcohol.
properties.Address: Gorse Hill Methodist Church, Wesley Street, Stretford
